channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden pardons Fauci, Milley and members of Jan. 6 panel
item.description: In a statement released Monday, President Biden said the pardons "should not be mistaken as an acknowledgment that any individual engaged in any wrongdoing." President-elect Trump has criticized many of the officials Biden pardoned.
item.content:encoded:
In a statement released Monday, President Biden said the pardons "should not be mistaken as an acknowledgment that any individual engaged in any wrongdoing." President-elect Trump has criticized many of the officials Biden pardoned.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Trump promised dozens of actions on immigration on Day 1. Here's what we know
item.description: Trump campaigned on border security promises, and he and his allies argue that his electoral win is an endorsement of his upcoming actions on the issue.
item.content:encoded:
Trump campaigned on border security promises, and he and his allies argue that his electoral win is an endorsement of his upcoming actions on the issue.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Inside Trump's Inauguration Day: How, when and what to watch
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump will take the oath of office at noon followed by a presidential parade, signing ceremony and inaugural balls.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump will take the oath of office at noon followed by a presidential parade, signing ceremony and inaugural balls.

(Image credit: Morry Gash)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Prince Harry's case against Rupert Murdoch's British tabloids goes to trial
item.description: A trial begins Tuesday over complaints filed by Prince Harry and a senior British lawmaker against Rupert Murdoch's tabloid newspapers. The trial carries high stakes on both sides of the Atlantic.
item.content:encoded:
A trial begins Tuesday over complaints filed by Prince Harry and a senior British lawmaker against Rupert Murdoch's tabloid newspapers. The trial carries high stakes on both sides of the Atlantic.

(Image credit: Kin Cheung/AP)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: What to know about Ohio State, Notre Dame and college football's championship game
item.description: That the Buckeyes and the Fighting Irish, two of the sport's most storied teams, are squaring off in the title game is a TV executive's dream — and a fitting end to the first-ever 12-team playoff.
item.content:encoded:
That the Buckeyes and the Fighting Irish, two of the sport's most storied teams, are squaring off in the title game is a TV executive's dream — and a fitting end to the first-ever 12-team playoff.

(Image credit: Alex Slitz)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: With fewer protesters and a renewed focus, activists plan for a second round of Trump
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump takes office Monday and Democratic organizers are not seeing the mass-scale opposition they witnessed in 2017. So, they're adjusting with a focus on Trump's agenda.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump takes office Monday and Democratic organizers are not seeing the mass-scale opposition they witnessed in 2017. So, they're adjusting with a focus on Trump's agenda.

(Image credit: Brian Munoz)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Village People founder says everybody can enjoy their music, Republican or Democrat
item.description: Victor Willis of the Village People says their music is for everyone, defending the group's choice to perform at Trump's inaugural celebrations as a message of inclusivity.
item.content:encoded:
Victor Willis of the Village People says their music is for everyone, defending the group's choice to perform at Trump's inaugural celebrations as a message of inclusivity.

(Image credit: Andrew Chin)
item.dc:creator: Majd Al-Waheidi

item.title: At least 80 people killed in northeast Colombia as peace talks fail, official says
item.description: Officials said the attacks happened in the Catatumbo region near the border with Venezuela, following the government's failed attempts to hold peace talks with the National Liberation Army.
item.content:encoded:
Officials said the attacks happened in the Catatumbo region near the border with Venezuela, following the government's failed attempts to hold peace talks with the National Liberation Army.

(Image credit: Fernando Vergara)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Photos: Families reunite as the Israel-Hamas ceasefire takes effect
item.description: After 15 months war, a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas took effect on Sunday morning.
item.content:encoded:
After 15 months war, a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas took effect on Sunday morning.

(Image credit: Mussa Qawasma)
item.dc:creator: Majd Al-Waheidi

item.title: Local meteorologists could face layoffs amid new initiative with The Weather Channel
item.description: The new initiative will be rolled out across 27 stations and feature "additional visual storytelling capabilities," Allen Media Group says.
item.content:encoded:
The new initiative will be rolled out across 27 stations and feature "additional visual storytelling capabilities," Allen Media Group says.

(Image credit: Chance Yeh)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster
